thread.title: Trailer for Peter Capaldi's final Doctor Who series promises menacing monsters, emoji-speaking robots and the return of Missy
thread.title_full: Trailer for Peter Capaldi's final Doctor Who series promises menacing monsters, emoji-speaking robots and the return of Missy

author: Vicki Newman
title: Trailer for Peter Capaldi's final Doctor Who series promises menacing monsters, emoji-speaking robots and the return of Missy
text:
Get celebs     
Doctor Who fans can rejoice as series 10 is nearly upon is. 
It will be Peter Capaldi's final outings as the Time Lord and he's sure to go out with a bang (and a glow). 
It's been a long time since Whovians have had a whole series to sink their teeth into. 
After last year went by with nothing but a Christmas special to give us our fix, a lot of excitement is building for these new episodes. 
But what is in store for the Doctor? Read More Peter Capaldi has the life of new companion in his hand in dramatic teaser for new Doctor Who series What is in store for Peter Capaldi's final series? (Photo: BBC) 
Right from the off, the trailer promises "pure drama" and we see the return of the Doctor's friend Nardole, played by Matt Lucas, and the introduction of new companion Bill, played by Pearl Mackie. 
Explaining his TARDIS to Bill, the Doctor says: "This is the gateway to everything that ever was, or ever can be." 
And he looks a bit upset when she tells him it looks like a "kitchen". 
As they hurtle through time and space, we see glimpses of them arriving in the year 1814, travelling to Mars, and plunging deep under the sea. Matt Lucas returns as Nardole (Photo: BBC) They meet an emoji-speaking robot (Photo: BBC) 
They meet emoji-speaking robots, and battle a host of new monsters, as well as old favourites like the Daleks. 
The trailer also teases the return of the Doctor's arch nemesis Missy (formerly known as the Master), portrayed by Michelle Gomez, who as usual, appears to have a few tricks up her sleeve. 
Ever since Peter announced he was retiring from his time as the Twelfth Doctor, speculation has been rife over who will take the iconic role on next. 
Death in Paradise star Kris Marshall is now the odds-on favourite to be the next Doctor. 
Bookies Ladbrokes stopped taking bets on him becoming the next Time Lord after a huge rush from punters. Pearl Mackie joins the show as companion Bill (Photo: BBC) 
The stampede came after Kris , 43, said he was calling it a day on his Caribbean-based cop show after four years because it meant being away from his family. 
Social media went into overdrive amid rumours that another reason he was quitting was ­because Peter is vacating his role. 
Many fans think Kris, currently playing a quirky detective, is ideal as the 13th Time Lord. 
Ladbrokes spokesman Alex ­Donohue admitted: “A surge of punters have backed Marshall so we’ve had no choice but to close the book.” 
* Doctor Who returns to BBC One from Saturday, April 15 Like us on Facebook
